text:
Royal rose Abu Dhabi welcomes new general manager Published on : Monday, August 17, 2015
City Seasons Hotels have appointed Mr. George Demitry as General Manager of their recently open hotel in the capital.Mr. Demitry moves in from City Seasons Muscat where he was general manager for the past 2 years,and successfully placed the property in the top list of hotels in Oman.
Hailing from Egyptian descent where he has started at Intercontinental Hotels, Mr. Demitry carries a bachelor degree in Science and is a certified Hotel Administrator by The American Hotel & Lodging Association- US. He brings along more than 17 years in the hospitality management spanning 8 local and international brands of which 3 Hotel openings. A long stint in Vancouver Canada had seen him overlooking Regional Operations for a North American Hotel chain.
Mr. Demitry‘s posting in Abu Dhabi is the second one after a previous tenure where he oversaw the opening and re-branding of City Seasons Al Hamra Abu Dhabi, in 2010.“I believe that successful Hotel management is an inevitable consequence of a systematic balance between efficient customer service, positive return on investment and employee development,” he says.

The 355-room hotel is the first 5-star property managed and owned by City Seasons Hotels and the flagship of the group. Similar properties are in the pipeline in a couple GCC countries.“We are happy to welcome Mr. Demitry back in UAE, says Sheikh Ahmed Musallam Bin Ham, Vice- President of the Group of hotels.
